taskDescription: Attempts to monitor Olivia’s cognitive game progress despite privacy restrictions
Relies on offline check-ins when unable to access Olivia’s data remotely
Wishes for more open data sharing from Olivia to tailor care plans
Focuses monitoring efforts on Elena due to better data accessibility
Acknowledges social and emotional benefits of gaming for Elena
Uses video calls to connect with Elena for health and wellbeing assessment
Remotely monitors patients’ vital signs during busy shifts
Expects ALFRED to filter out all non-essential notifications
Receives alerts only for critical health anomalies
Focuses solely on clinical data without engaging in emotional support features
Prioritizes immediate health needs over privacy concerns
Avoids distraction caused by non-clinical system interactions
Relies on ALFRED for continuous vital sign tracking
Overrides caregiver and patient preferences when clinical urgency arises
Receive and review notifications about new app integrations in ALFRED
Access patient vital signs through the ALFRED system during clinical shifts
Express frustration with persistent pop-ups and forced app features
Navigate a cluttered interface to find essential clinical data efficiently
Advocate for a simpler, streamlined interface focused on caregiving needs
Seek to respect patient consent and autonomy regarding data sharing
Resist app-imposed mandatory updates and data collection that disrupt care
Communicate concerns about app design choices that ignore patient boundaries
Configure ALFRED’s clinical settings focusing on vital signs monitoring
Schedule medication reminders through ALFRED
Prioritize access to clinical data for timely intervention
Insist on data sharing with caregivers to ensure user safety
Monitor and respond to prioritized health alerts from ALFRED
Express frustration when non-critical alerts and interactive modes are disabled
Use a formal and direct communication style during onboarding
Ensure automatic logging of clinical data is enabled and accessible
